text: Vui Manu'a was a Western Samoan chief and politician. He served as a member of the Legislative Assembly from 1948 to 1954. ==Biography== Following the creation of the Legislative Assembly in 1948, he was chosen to represent Fa'asaleleaga by the three Fautua (high chiefs).W. Samoa's New Assembly Now Taking Shape: Samoan Members Chosen Pacific Islands Monthly, May 1948, p49 He was re-elected in 1951,Western Samoan Assembly election Pacific Islands Monthly, May 1951, p9 serving until the 1954 elections. ==References== Category:Samoan chiefs Category:Members of the Legislative Assembly of Samoa
title: Vui Manu'a
